_exec_summary.SummaryText:
(a)    Jayhawk Fine Chemicals accidental release prevention and emergency response policies are in force and include Emergency Response Plan SH-014 and Environmental Management Plan MSP-023.



(b)    Jayhawk Fine Chemicals, Inc. (Jayhawk operates a batch specialty chemical manufacturing facility near Galena, Kansas.  The industrial area within which Jayhawk property and manufacturing operations are located is known locally as the Jayhawk Plant, dating back to its creation in the 1940s. That portion of the Jayhawk Plant Site containing Jayhawk property, buildings and equipment will be referred to hereinafter as the "Facility". 



    The Facility is located on approximately 850 acres of a 2,200-acre industrial complex. Jayhawk's Unit 1 encompasses approximately 29 acres and Unit 2 encompasses approximately 25 acres. The Facility is located approximately 3.5 miles north of the junction of Kansas Route 66 and U.S. Highway 400 at Riverton, Kansas. 



    The regulated substances handled at Jayhawk include:

1.    Acetaldehyde CAS # 75-07-0

2.    Ammonia (water solution) 24% CAS # 7664-41-7

3.    Anhydrous Ammonia CAS # 7664-41-7

4.    Chlorine CAS # 7782-50-5

5.    Isopropyl Chloroformate CAS # 108-23-6

6.    Methyl Chloroformate CAS # 79-22-01

7.    Methyl Chloride CAS # 74-87-3

8.    Propylene CAS# 115-07-1

9.    Phosphorous Trichloride CAS# 7719-12-2

10.    Tetramethylsilane CAS # 75-76-3

11.    Titanium Tetrachloride CAS # 7550-45-0

12.    Trimethylchlorosilane CAS # 75-77-4

    

(c)    Jayhawk ensures accident prevention through the development and maintenance of process safety information, performing process hazard analyses on covered systems and a program to address any deficiencies noted during the reviews, writing and maintaining current operating procedures with operator participation, training employees with appropriate knowledge to safely perform their jobs, ensuring equipment functionality with a thorough mechanical integrity program, reviewing and documenting all changes affecting covered proc

esses and training employees to the changes prior to start-up, performing pre-startup safety reviews, completing compliance audits at least every three years, investigate incidents within 48 hours of the incident and involve employees and/or contractors, following the site written employee participation plan, utilizing the site work permit policy that includes hot work permitting, complying with the site policy for contractor safety, and through training and following the site emergency response plan intended to protect human health and the environment.





Worst-Case:

NOTE:  A summary of the off-site consequence analysis (OCA) for the worst-case and alternative release scenarios(s) is no longer required to be included in the Executive Summary. While the RMP rule originally required that the Executive Summary briefly describe the OCA for worst-case and alternative release scenario(s), EPA amended the RMP rule in 2004 to remove this requirement because of security concerns. Your Executive Summary should not describe nor include information concerning your worst case or alternative release scenarios.

Worst case scenarios were developed for each regulated chemical. The assumptions made included that the chemical was instantaneously released through catastrophic failure of the container, and if there were multiple containers of a single chemical within the same proximity, the release included the entire contents of all of the containers.



Acetaldehyde

Jayhawk's facility includes a two tank that contains acetaldehyde. It is used as a primary raw material in the production of one of the finished products in Unit 1. Acetaldehyde in the quantity stored requires that the system comply with RMP Program Level III regulations. 

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for the acetaldehyde tank (worst case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 1 residential person located within the radius of the worst-c

ase scenario.



Aqua Ammonia 20-30%

Jayhawk's facility includes a tank that contains <30% (+/-) aqua ammonia. It is used as a scrubber media for the removal of nitrogen oxides from Unit 1 production processes. Aqua ammonia stored in the quantity indicated requires that the system comply with RMP Program Level III regulations. 

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for Aqua Ammonia tank (worst case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 1 residential person located within the radius of the worst-case scenario.



Anhydrous Ammonia

Jayhawk's facility includes a tank that contains anhydrous ammonia. It is used to produce the scrubber media for the removal of nitrogen oxides from Unit 1 production processes. Anhydrous Ammonia in the quantity stored requires that the system comply with RMP Program Level III regulations. 

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for the anhydrous ammonia tank (worst case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 3095 residential persons located within the radius of the worst-case scenario.



Chlorine

Jayhawk's facility includes cylinders of chlorine. A maximum of twelve (12) full cylinders will be stored on site. It is used as a primary raw material in the production of product in Unit 2. Chlorine will only be on site typically for one month per year. Chlorine stored in the quantity indicated requires that the system comply with RMP Program Level III regulations. 

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for chlorine (worst case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 5985 persons located within the radius of the worst-case scenario.



Isopropyl Chloroformate

Jayhawk's facility includes a refrigerated storage area that contains 55-gallon drums containing an isopropyl chloroformate. It is used as a raw material in the production o

f product in Unit 2. Isopropyl chloroformate stored in the quantity indicated requires that the system comply with RMP Program Level III regulations. 

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for isopropyl chloroformate storage warehouse (worst case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 14 persons located within the radius of the worst-case scenario.



Methyl Chloroformate

Jayhawk's facility includes 55 gal drums that contains methyl chloroformate. Methyl Chloroformate is used as a raw material in the production of one of the finished products in Unit 2. Methyl chloroformate stored in the quantity indicated requires that the system comply with RMP Program Level III regulations. 

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no potential environmental receptors for the methyl chloroformate storage (worst case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 1479 persons located within the radius of the worst-case scenario.



Methyl Chloride

Jayhawk's facility includes cylinders or ISO containers of methyl chloride. Methyl Chloride is used as a raw material in the production of product in Unit 2. Methyl chloride stored in the quantity indicated requires that the system comply with RMP Program Level III regulations.  

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no potential environmental receptors for the methyl chloride storage (worst case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 1479 persons located within the radius of the worst-case scenario.



Propylene

Jayhawk facility contains Propylene stored in bulk. Propylene used as a raw material in the production of one of the finished products in Unit 2.  Propylene stored in the quantity indicated requires that the system comply with RMP Program Level III regulations.

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no potential environmental receptors for the propylene sto

rage (worst case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 1 person located within the radius of the worst-case scenario.



Phosphorous Trichloride (PCl3)

Jayhawk facility contains PCl3 stored in bulk.  The PCl3 is used as a raw material in the production of one of the finished products in Unit 2.  PCl3 stored in the quantity indicated requires that the system comply with RMP Program Level III regulations.  

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no potential environmental receptors for the PCl3 storage (worst case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 1479 persons located within the radius of the worst-case scenario.



Tetramethylsilane

Jayhawk facility contains Tetramethylsilane stored in Iso containers. Tetramethylsilane is one of the finished products in Unit 2.  stored in the quantity indicated requires that the system comply with RMP Program Level III regulations. Tetramethylsilane stored in the quantity indicated requires that the system comply with RMP Program Level III regulations.

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no potential environmental receptors within for the trimethylchlorosilane storage (worst case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately no people located within the radius of the worst-case scenario.



Titanium tetrachloride (TiCl4)

Jayhawk's facility includes 55 gal drums that contains TiCl4. TiCl4 is used as a raw material in the production of one of the finished products in Unit 2. TiCl4 stored in the quantity indicated requires that the system comply with RMP Program Level III regulations. 

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no potential environmental receptors for the TiCl4 storage (worst case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 1479 persons located within the radius of the worst-case scenario.



Trimethylchlorosilane

Jayhawk facility contains Trimethylchlorosilane stored in

bulk. Trimethylchlorosilane is used as a raw material for a finished material produced in Unit 2.  Trimethylchlorosilane stored in the quantity indicated requires that the system comply with RMP Program Level III regulations.

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no potential environmental receptors for the Trimethylchlorosilane storage (worst case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 1479 persons located within the radius of the worst-case scenario.



Alternative Case

The catastrophic failure of the containers, or simultaneous failure of all containers for a chemical, is highly unlikely. The tanks and cylinders have safety devices and systems to prevent or minimize the effect of any accidental release. An alternative scenario has been selected for each chemical that, although still very unlikely to occur, has a higher probability of occurrence than the worst-case scenario, in accordance with U.S. EPA guidance.

Residential population, public receptors and environmental receptors were assessed for each chemical within the radius of its associated endpoint. In most there was residential population, no environmental receptors, and the only public receptor that appears in the available data is the Boston Mills School located one-half mile east. This school was investigated and no longer exists. Therefore, there are no public receptors within the maximum endpoint radius of the alternative case scenarios.



Acetaldehyde

A more likely scenario for acetaldehyde is the failure of the railcar unloading system. The chemical is transferred to the tank using nitrogen pressure and a closed loop system, and should a hose fail, the entire contents of the tank might escape. The alternative scenario for acetaldehyde is the failure of a 2-inch unloading line releasing all of the contents of a tank. 

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for the acetaldehyde tank (alternative case). Th

e demographic data indicates that there are approximately 0 people located within the radius of the alternative case scenario.



Aqua Ammonia 20-30%

A more likely scenario for <30% aqua ammonia is the failure of a connection on the tank. The alternative scenario for <30% aqua ammonia is the failure of a 1-inch line releasing all of the contents of a tank.

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors within for the aqua ammonia tank (alternative case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 1 person located within the radius of the alternative case scenario.



Anhydrous Ammonia

A more likely scenario for anhydrous ammonia is the failure of a connection on the tank. The alternative scenario for anhydrous ammonia is the failure of a 1-inch line releasing all of the contents of a tank. 

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for the anhydrous ammonia tank (alternative case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 1 person located within the radius of the alternative case scenario.



Chlorine

A more likely scenario for chlorine is the failures of a single cylinder during handling. Therefore, the alternative scenario involves the release of chlorine from the liquid side of a cylinder. 

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for the chlorine cylinders (alternative case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 1 person located within the radius of the alternative case scenario.



Isopropyl Chloroformate

A more likely scenario for isopropyl chloroformate is the puncture of 55-gallon drum during process operations. 

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for the isopropyl chloroformate drum (alternative case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 0 persons located within the radius of the alternative

case scenario. 



Methyl Chloroformate                                                                                          

A more likely scenario for methyl chloroformate is the puncture of 55-gallon drum during process operations.  

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for the Methyl Chloroformate drum (alternative case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 14 persons located within the radius of the alternative case scenario.



Methyl Chloride

A more likely scenario for methyl chloride is the leak from cylinder or ISO during process operations.  

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for the Methyl Chloride leak (alternative case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 1 person located within the radius of the alternative case scenario.



Propylene

A more likely scenario for Propylene is the failures of a transfer line or hose. Therefore, the alternative scenario involves the release of Propylene through a 3-inch rupture in a container. 

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for the Propylene alternative case scenario. The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 0 persons located within the radius of the alternative case scenario.



Phosphorous Trichloride (PCl3)

A more likely scenario for PCl3 is the failure of a charge pipe during process operations.  

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors within for the PCl3 drum (alternative case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 14 persons located within the radius of the alternative case scenario.



Tetramethylsilane

A more likely scenario for Tetramethylsilane is a process line leak during process operations.

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for the Tetramethylsilane leak (

alternative case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 0 people located within the radius of the alternative case scenario.



Titanium tetrachloride (TiCl4)

A more likely scenario for TiCl4 is a process line leak from during process operations.  

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for the TiCl4 leak (alternative case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 0 persons located within the radius of the alternative case scenario.



Trimethylchlorosilane

A more likely scenario for Trimethylchlorosilane is a process line leak during process operations.  

The off-site consequence analysis indicates that there are no environmental receptors for the Trimethylchlorosilane leak (alternative case). The demographic data indicates that there are approximately 1479 persons located within the radius of the alternative case scenario.



(d)    Jayhawk operates a modern facility with state-of-the-art safety policies, practices, and systems. There have been no off-site consequences involving regulated processes, or regulated chemicals, at the facility. There is no five-year accident history involving either regulated processes or chemicals that involve personnel injury, death, or significant property damage.  



(e)    The facility has an Emergency Response Plan intended to protect human health and the environment. There is a procedure for the notification of local emergency response agencies and the public. Training is provided to all employees on the Emergency Response Plan and the emergency equipment available at the facility. This Emergency Response Plan is updated as often as necessary, but not less than once every three years.  Emergency response is provided by the Galena, KS Fire Department with mutual aid assistance agreements with Columbus, and Baxter Springs, KS Fire Departments. Columbus is located approximately 10 miles northwest of the facility, and Baxter Springs is located a

pproximately 10 miles southwest of the facility. There is a Local Emergency Planning Commission (LEPC) for Cherokee County, KS. Mutual aid response times are approximately 30 minutes from the initiation of the notice. There is a Jayhawk staffed Emergency Response Team which has training in incipient stage fire response. Additional support is provided through coordination of the emergency with outside agencies through use of the plant telephone and emergency notification system.



(f)    Apart from compliance with specific guidelines, the policy of Jayhawk Fine Chemicals is also aligned to continuous development, especially in terms of plant and occupational safety, environmental protection, protecting the health of its employees, product safety, transportation safety and site security.  Specifically, JFC operates with a policy of investigating near misses and incidents and includes findings into updates of our safety management policies and procedures.  Communication to plant personnel is routinely held to inform and train employees on improvements learned from the incident reporting management system.



Planned changes to improve safety:

Jayhawk utilizes the LOPA (layer of protection analysis) for process hazard analysis of each covered process.  This detailed analysis guides the site in determining specific prevention measures to preclude accidents. Jayhawk Fine Chemicals capital plan includes projects to improve occupational safety and environmental protection. One aspect of Jayhawk Fine Chemicals capital project planning process is driven by the review of hazards during the LOPA PHA process. This process often identifies best available technologies which are routinely employed to reduce risk. A distributed control system (DCS) is utilized to improve control of operating processes. This system is updated routinely to maintain the safety of our processes.
